snippet.textDisplay:
It's clearly not a game that you enjoy playing, and the first thirty hours are just the begining.
It comes really more interessting in the end of the first game, then the story never stop being incredible, the universe of Xenosaga is incredibly complex and the hardest is to enter into this complexity I agree. But once you're inside it's really hard to separate from the characters since they're all so nicely written ! :)
snippet.textOriginal:
It's clearly not a game that you enjoy playing, and the first thirty hours are just the begining.
It comes really more interessting in the end of the first game, then the story never stop being incredible, the universe of Xenosaga is incredibly complex and the hardest is to enter into this complexity I agree. But once you're inside it's really hard to separate from the characters since they're all so nicely written ! :)

snippet.textDisplay: +Retrauk Sort of the same here. I'm a fan of RPG but also only thoroughly enjoyed a few selected ones. I tried the first game in the Xenosaga series and stopped playing after maybe thirty hours as it felt really tideous and quite frankly boring. Maybe I would enjoy it a lot more if I kept playing but when it feels like a chore to play through I rather not.
snippet.textOriginal: +Retrauk Sort of the same here. I'm a fan of RPG but also only thoroughly enjoyed a few selected ones. I tried the first game in the Xenosaga series and stopped playing after maybe thirty hours as it felt really tideous and quite frankly boring. Maybe I would enjoy it a lot more if I kept playing but when it feels like a chore to play through I rather not.

snippet.textDisplay: For Xenosaga 3 the battle system was dumbed down to the level of typical Final Fantasy systems where you just have a menu of different levels of the same spell. The original authors were removed from the project and the story was finished by writers who had no idea what the subject matter was or what it meant.
snippet.textOriginal: For Xenosaga 3 the battle system was dumbed down to the level of typical Final Fantasy systems where you just have a menu of different levels of the same spell. The original authors were removed from the project and the story was finished by writers who had no idea what the subject matter was or what it meant.

snippet.textDisplay:
It's supposed to be distantly linked I believe. The Xenosaga series takes place before xenogears does. Sort of an alternate universe take on the same story.
For example, remember the very beginning of gears when the ship crashes into the planet. I believe it was being attacked by the Gnosis(saga). 
The games aren't absolutely related, but I know Xenogears was number 4 in what was supposed to be a series. Then saga had episodes 1-3. It's the best we'll ever get to a series supporting Xenogears.
snippet.textOriginal:
It's supposed to be distantly linked I believe. The Xenosaga series takes place before xenogears does. Sort of an alternate universe take on the same story.
For example, remember the very beginning of gears when the ship crashes into the planet. I believe it was being attacked by the Gnosis(saga). 
The games aren't absolutely related, but I know Xenogears was number 4 in what was supposed to be a series. Then saga had episodes 1-3. It's the best we'll ever get to a series supporting Xenogears.

snippet.textDisplay:
There's plenty of hope, but no one wants to finance it, it seems--everyone wants the next Pokemon, but no one wants to pay for it, let alone the next Xenogears or Xenosaga! 

Please see my videos for a great space opera game that should have been popular too. 

I will never understand why casual gamers have the control over the industry they do. Since when are the ignorant, unqualified, and uncaring allowed to possess such power?
snippet.textOriginal:
There's plenty of hope, but no one wants to finance it, it seems--everyone wants the next Pokemon, but no one wants to pay for it, let alone the next Xenogears or Xenosaga! 

Please see my videos for a great space opera game that should have been popular too. 

I will never understand why casual gamers have the control over the industry they do. Since when are the ignorant, unqualified, and uncaring allowed to possess such power?

Why is it that quality doesn't matter anymore in the game industry?! Xenosaga deserved to be up there with Final Fantasy and last for more than 10 years!

snippet.textDisplay: I miss it too - and I personally thought they screwed up the story part in Episode 3 big time... All those years I had been waiting for an explanation of everything that had been going on in Ep 1 + 2...hoping for one flashback after another, just like in Xenogears. but then they go and change who's in charge of the scenarios and all we get in ep 3 is way too much mainstream focus on the whole love affairs... whereas the real answers to the story were mainly just scrambled into the database :/
snippet.textOriginal: I miss it too - and I personally thought they screwed up the story part in Episode 3 big time... All those years I had been waiting for an explanation of everything that had been going on in Ep 1 + 2...hoping for one flashback after another, just like in Xenogears. but then they go and change who's in charge of the scenarios and all we get in ep 3 is way too much mainstream focus on the whole love affairs... whereas the real answers to the story were mainly just scrambled into the database :/

snippet.textDisplay:
I don't understand why. Xenosaga I sold rather well, so why did they find it necessary to screw over the development team by changing it up for Ep. 2? And why did it take them 3 games to get a look as sleek and polished for Ep. 3, which, if implemented earlier, would have helped the series sell more? 

I miss Xenosaga.
snippet.textOriginal:
I don't understand why. Xenosaga I sold rather well, so why did they find it necessary to screw over the development team by changing it up for Ep. 2? And why did it take them 3 games to get a look as sleek and polished for Ep. 3, which, if implemented earlier, would have helped the series sell more? 

I miss Xenosaga.
